text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot thai kitchen today 
i am making noodle soup and if you remember my

episode on the top 5 noodle soups that you must 
have when you go to Thailand this one made the

list I am making video tom yum or tom 
noodle now as a refresher let's go back and

take a look at what Tom Yum noodle is now you may 
recognise the word some young as being that famous

lemongrass soup but this is a little bit different 
so this is how we feel tom yum or tom yam

noodles now what makes this a tom yum is the 
fact that it's flavoured with lime juice chili

flakes and brown peanuts those are the three main 
characteristic of a quickie um yum and it usually

involves ground torque alright let's start with 
the broth most high noodle soups start out with a

pork stock so I've got in here some pork bones if 
you don't need mark you can also do chicken bones

just going to cover it with water and bring it to 
a simmer not a vigorous boil just to a simmer so

after the broth has simmered for about 45 minutes 
to an hour skim off all the scum that has floated

to the top so at this point I'm going to add my 
aromatic some garlic which I crushed and also

some cilantro roots if you don't have cilantro 
roots stems would be okay some white peppercorns

that I cracked finally this is optional but if 
you've got tops of lemongrass you can also add

those in as well now the tops of lemongrass 
has a much milder flavor than the bottom half

so I don't use it for cooking but I save it for 
stock making and so the lemongrass flavor won't

overpower everything else so now I'm going to let 
this go for another hour and then we are ready

to go while the stock is simmering let's prepare 
all the other components so I've got ground pork

which is a key component of any Tom Yum noodle 
and if you don't eat pork again you can always

do chicken cook the pork just in a little bit of 
water I don't want to add any extra fat these in

the park a little bit with some fish sauce and 
it's going to seem like it's sticking to the

bottom at the beginning but don't worry as things 
cook the juices will come out and everything will

work out in the end let's take a look at the rest 
of the components of Thummim noodle fried garlic

and garlic oil it is indispensable to pretty much 
all Thai noodle soup all you do is chop up some

garlic and fry it in a little bit of vegetable 
oil just enough to cover the garlic until it's

golden brown like this next roasted chili flakes 
I took some dry Thai chilies and I roasted them

in the oven at 300 degrees for about five to 
seven minutes until they turn a little darker

and smoky and then it ground them up in a coffee 
grinder now what I did for this batch is I threw

in a couple of kaffir lime leaves as well and it's 
all ground up in here and it makes really aromatic

roasted chili flakes mmm chili vinegar kale 
prick nam som this is basically just some Thai

chilies soaking in plain white vinegar we always 
have chili vinegar when we eat noodle soup kind

of optional you don't have to add it all right 
let's talk noodle options I am using egg noodles

thin egg noodles because I prefer these for this 
particular soup but you can also do rice noodles

however choose smaller thinner ones because 
the broth is a light broth thick fat noodles

don't work quite as well it tends to overwhelm 
the broth additional protein option fish cakes

there are many many different types of fish cakes 
on the market sometimes it's in the refrigerated

sort of fresh seafood section sometimes the 
frozen Department you can choose whatever type

of fish case you like there's no right or wrong 
that's way more than I'll need but that's okay

time to put everything together ideally you would 
have two burners two pots going one for blanching

your noodles and everything and the other one 
for your soup first I'm going to blanch my bean

sprouts and I'm also going to blanch my fish cakes 
just quickly this is literally a few seconds okay

and in goes to the serving bowl next I'm going to 
blanch my noodles how long this cooks completely

depends on what type of noodles you are using 
always remember to undercook the noodles just

slightly because we're going to pour hot soup 
over the noodles and it's going to sit in there

so it will continue to cook for a little shake 
off as much water as you can and in the ghost so

this pot is done so I'm just going to bring the 
fish cakes up on top just so it's prettier when

we go to serve it just a few pieces ground pork as 
much as you want I like a lot of ground pork all

right let's work on the broth the street vendor 
always finishes the broth one bowl at a time

because people always like to order extra spicy 
extra sour you know there's always customization

so that's what I'm going to do so for each bowl 
two teaspoons of sugar I know that looks like a

lot but trust me once it's all said and done it 
won't taste particularly sweet fish sauce equal

amount since this is some yam noodle we have to 
have sour and I'm going to add some lime juice

a little extra I like sour the roasted chili 
flakes peanuts roasted ground peanuts and the

nuttiness helps balance all that sourness but 
of course if you're allergic you can do ground

sesame seeds if you'd like I like to add about 
6 ounces of broth mmm the broth smells so good

this broth is good for any kind of noodle soup 
off it goes oh looks so good extra cilantro one

top garlic oil that I said was so indispensable 
also a little bit of that chili vinegar if you're

making this for the first time taste it first 
before you add the chili vinegar just to see

where you're at time to eat it's spicy it's hard 
but it's well balanced by the peanuts now this of

course is the ultimate customizable food you can 
adjust the flavor according to your liking more

lime or fish sauce whatever you like so the 
recipe is on hot Thai Kitchen calm when you

make this send me a photo on Facebook Twitter 
or Instagram and I will see you next time for

your next build this type and bring it to a 
simmer not a vigorous boil just to a simmer
